item.title: Tim add a quote by Soren Kierkegaard
item.description: "One must not think slightingly of the paradoxical…for the paradox is the source of the thinker’s passion, and the thinker without a paradox is like a lover without feeling: a paltry mediocrity." -- Soren Kierkegaard

item.title: Tim add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
Tim add a quote by Martin Heidegger
item.description: "The possible ranks higher than the actual." -- Martin Heidegger

item.title: Tim add a quote by dzogchen tantra
item.description: "As a bee seeks nectar from all kinds of flowers seek teachings everywhere. Like a deer that finds a quiet place to graze seek seclusion to digest all that you have gathered. Like a mad one beyond all limits go where you please and live like a lion completely free of all fear." -- dzogchen tantra

item.title: Tim add a quote by niels bohr
item.description: "Everything we call real is made of things that cannot be regarded as real." -- niels bohr

item.title: Tim add a quote by Robert M. Pirsig
item.description: "Mental patterns do not originate out of inorganic nature. They originate out of society, which originates out of inorganic nature. And, as anthropologists know so well, what a mind thinks is as dominated by biological patterns as social patterns are dominated by biological patterns and as biological patterns are dominated by inorganic patterns. There is no direct scientific connection between mind and matter. As the atomic scientist, Niels Bohr, said, "We are suspended in language." Our intellectual description of nature is always culturally derived." -- Robert M. Pirsig

item.title: Tim add a quote by Michael Crichton
item.description: "If you don't know history, then you don't know anything. You are a leaf that doesn't know it is part of a tree. " -- Michael Crichton
